channel.title: Itemdef
channel.description:
I have been recently trying to change the names of items already existing in the file "Itemdef.xml". Lets just say I change "Coins" to "Money" in the file, I save it, put it in the xml compresser. Compress it then replace the file "Itemdef.xml.gz" that already exists with the new one. I then compile all of the server files. Which is successful, I load it up, no problems. I then login and try look at the item that I have changed the name of, and no effect. It is still "Coins" instead of "Money". What am I doing wrong? Also I copied RSCD.jar into the client once compiled from the server files, still no effect.
I also get the same problem with any definition file I try to edit.

item.title: Itemdef
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

If you edit ItemsDef.xml (server side), make it correspond and be exactly the same in client side, Items.rscd.

Read full topic

item.title: Itemdef
item.dc:creator: @liquidazer liquidazer
item.description:
@liquidazer wrote:

its RSCD v 25, that Im using[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 06, 2009, 10:42:51 pm[/size][hr]Sorry, I think I just figured it out. Thanks for the help

Read full topic

item.title: Itemdef
item.dc:creator: @Kozy Kozy
item.description:
@Kozy wrote:

You have to Itemdef.xml in the client, and I think Items.rscd on the server? I believe… I can’t remember anything about RSCD 0,o. Demonik was hard to get used to…

And btw, you don’t have to compile after XML-ing.

-Kozy

Read full topic

item.title: Itemdef
item.dc:creator: @liquidazer liquidazer
item.description:
@liquidazer wrote:

I have been recently trying to change the names of items already existing in the file “Itemdef.xml”. Lets just say I change “Coins” to “Money” in the file, I save it, put it in the xml compresser. Also I copied RSCD.jar into the client once compiled from the server files, still no effect.

I also get the same problem with any definition file I try to edit.
